messages.subject: Re: deschooling and long hours of computer games...
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks, Sandra I did a search on this board for TV and Video Games and came across a couple of good discussions. I ll hit unschooling.com and do a search
messages.messageBody:
Thanks, Sandra

I did a search on this board for TV and Video Games and came across a
couple of good discussions. I'll hit unschooling.com and do a search
there.

Peace,HeidiC

p.s. is there another HeidiC running around in the unschooling online
community? I saw someone who looked JUST LIKE ME L at "Learning for
Life" board while lurking there.

veges
>

for TV
> threads. It almost always turns into video and games.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] deschooling and long hours of computer games...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/30/03 6:39:34 AM, bunsofaluminum60@hotmail.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/30/03 6:39:34 AM, bunsofaluminum60@... writes:

<< SOMETHING to help me keep my tongue behind my teeth as Robby veges

out. :) my hubby, too.

>>

You could go to unschooling.com, open up "message boards" and look for TV
threads. It almost always turns into video and games.

Or here:

http://sandradodd.com/games/page

messages.subject: deschooling and long hours of computer games...
messages.msgSnippet: when I posted here in Jan/Feb for a week or so, there were a few posts from (someone) from the archives, about a nervous mom whose kids did so much TV and
messages.messageBody:
when I posted here in Jan/Feb for a week or so, there were a few
posts from (someone) from the archives, about a nervous mom whose
kids did so much TV and video, and the struggles she was having to
trust that they'd eventually get over it.

CAn someone point me to those posts? I saw them end of Jan, early
Feb, but they were from archives. Or articles about nervous parents
who watch their kids in front of the TV and video games, who got over
it. Or, links about the blossoming of the kids when they finished
deschooling.

SOMETHING to help me keep my tongue behind my teeth as Robby veges
out. :) my hubby, too.

thanks, Heidi who is off to read that article again, on deschooling.
